content: In 1924 which 'Great Gatsby' author spent time living in France as part of the expatriate community known as the "Lost Generation"?

F. Scott Fitzgerald is the author of "The Great Gatsby," and he did spend time living in France as part of the expatriate community known as the "Lost Generation" in the 1920s. However, specifically in 1924, he was actually living in France where he completed the draft of "The Great Gatsby." So, to answer your question, it was F. Scott Fitzgerald who spent time in France in 1924 as part of the "Lost Generation."
